item.title: #CallToAction
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#CallToAction

Black Lives Matter 5280

I have testified against a police officer before this same commission in the past. They listened to our experiences, and the disciplinary actions were upheld. I... can only hope they will keep that same energy in a case dealing with far more dehumanizing behavior than what I experienced.

We all know these officers deserve worse than simply the loss of their jobs.

Call and Email the Aurora Civil Service Commission today and let them know that. Tell them we are not safe with people who think the brutal murder of #ElijahMcClain is a laughing matter terrorizing OUR streets without impunity. Demand that they uphold the disciplinary action taken, because we will not settle for less.

(303) 326-8931
civilservice@auroragov.orgÔøº

No justice, No peace,
-Ari
#JusticeForElijahMcClain #ElijahCriedPower #DefundThePolice #DefendBlackLives

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Scholarship opportunity! The Sachs Scholarship can be up to...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Scholarship opportunity! The Sachs Scholarship can be up to $10,000 for a 4-year degree. Applications will be available January 1st, and scholarships can be used at any accredited institution worldwide. Students can also apply for Graduate Scholarships at the end of their Undergraduate career, and specialized scholarships are offered to honor Sachs Alumni.

Terrell Brown is the Scholarship Administrator and can be reached at terrell@sachsfoundation.org
https://www.sachsfoundation.org/‚Ä¶

The Sachs Foundation's mission is to provide college scholarships to Black/African-American residents of Colorado who meet academic and financial criteria.

sachsfoundation.org

Sachs Foundation

The Sachs Foundation's mission is to provide college scholarships to Black/African-American residents of Colorado who meet academic and financial criteria.The Sachs Foundation's mission is to provide college scholarships to Black/African-American residents of Colorado who meet academic and financial criteria.

item.title: ‚ÄúSeasonal depression and treatment during this time is a...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúSeasonal depression and treatment during this time is a little tricky. Some of the things we would recommend are hindered by COVID-19, especially with the escalating rates. So, things like getting outside might be risky for some people with the transmission of COVID -19, so we‚Äôre thinking about some of the basic things to just take care of yourself. What are your coping skills? What are things that do get you involved and happy and excited?" says Dr. Apryl Alexander, a psych...ologist and professor at the University of Denver.

Dr. Alexander says a recent study from the American Psychological Association reports that eight in 10 Americans are feeling stressed because of COVID-19. Even though we're in a pandemic, Dr. Alexander says it's still important to socialize, especially if you are prone to seasonal depression.

"So, how can you maintain those social connections during this time, whether its dance parties we‚Äôve had in our department during COVID-19 to engaging with your family members on Zoom or other forms of social media," says Dr. Alexander.

Dr. Alexander also says many psychologists and therapists are offering virtual sessions, so it's important to take advantage of tele-mental health visits. And with the holiday season approaching, whether you're able to be with family or not, make sure you also take the time to check in on loved ones who may not be feeling themselves this winter season.‚Äù

See MoreSocial isolation from the pandemic and any unhealthy habits that might normally form in the winter months could exacerbate seasonal depression.

thedenverchannel.com

Experts concerned about seasonal affective disorder this winter, amid pandemic

Social isolation from the pandemic and any unhealthy habits that might normally form in the winter months could exacerbate seasonal depression.Social isolation from the pandemic and any unhealthy habits that might normally form in the winter months could exacerbate seasonal depression.

item.title: #DEMANDS...
item.content:encoded:
#DEMANDS
Immediately fire and revoke the pensions of the officers that murdered Breonna.
Divest from LMPD and Invest in community building
Immediate resignation (or impeachment) of Mayor Greg Fisher
Metro Council ends use of force by Louisville Metro Police Department.
Police shootings are gun violence.
A local, civilian community police accountability council that is independent from the Mayor’s Office and LMPD with investigation and discipline power #CPAC.
The creation of policy to ensure transparent investigation processes
#JusticeforBre #SayHerName
#DefundPolice #DefendBlackLife #KeepGoing #BlackLivesMatterLouisville #JusticeForBreonnaTaylor #InvestDivest

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
